text: What does a circular sign with a red border showing '20' and text 'ZONE' mean?
explanation: A red circle with 20 and ZONE indicates the start of a 20 mph speed limit zone, usually in residential areas with traffic calming measures.

text: What does a circular sign with '20' crossed through with a black diagonal line mean?
explanation: The diagonal line crossing through the 20 mph zone sign indicates the end of the 20 mph speed restriction.

text: What does a circular sign with a black diagonal stripe on white background mean?
explanation: A white circle with a black diagonal stripe indicates that the national speed limit applies (70 mph on motorways/dual carriageways, 60 mph on single carriageways for cars).

text: What shape is a STOP sign?
explanation: STOP signs are octagonal (8-sided) - this is the only sign with this shape in the UK, making it instantly recognizable even when obscured.

text: What does an inverted triangle (point down) with red border mean?

options.B: Give way to traffic on major road

explanation: An inverted triangle with red border is a Give Way sign, instructing you to give priority to traffic on the major road.

text: What does a circular sign with a red border and white center (no symbols) mean?
explanation: A red circle on its own (white center, no symbols) means no entry for all vehicles except bicycles being pushed.

text: What does a solid red circle mean?
explanation: A solid red circle (filled) means no entry for any vehicles - you must not proceed past this sign.

text: What does a red circle with a white horizontal bar mean?
explanation: A red circle with a white horizontal bar is the 'No Entry' sign for vehicles.

text: What does a red circle with a car symbol mean?
explanation: A red circle showing a car symbol means no motor vehicles are allowed (except motorcycles without sidecars).

text: What does a red circle with two cars side by side mean?
explanation: Two cars shown side by side in a red circle means no overtaking.

text: What does a red circle with LEFT TURN arrow crossed out mean?
explanation: A red circle with a left arrow crossed means no left turn permitted.

text: What does a red circle with RIGHT TURN arrow crossed out mean?
explanation: A red circle with a right arrow crossed means no right turn permitted.

text: What does a red circle with a lorry/truck symbol mean?

options.B: No goods vehicles over weight shown

explanation: A red circle with a lorry symbol indicates no goods vehicles over the maximum gross weight shown (in tonnes).

text: What does a red circle showing 4.4m with a vertical arrow mean?
explanation: A red circle with a height measurement and vertical arrow shows the maximum height of vehicles allowed to pass.

text: What does a red circle showing metres with a horizontal double-headed arrow mean?
explanation: A red circle with a width measurement and horizontal double-headed arrow indicates maximum vehicle width.

text: What does a red circle with a red cross (X) mean?
explanation: A red circle with a red X means Clearway - no stopping on the carriageway during the times shown (or at any time if no times shown).

text: What does a red circle with one diagonal red line mean?
explanation: A red circle with one red diagonal line means no waiting (no stopping to load/unload or set down/pick up passengers).

text: What do blue circular signs with white symbols indicate?
explanation: Blue circular signs give mandatory instructions (positive orders) that must be obeyed.

text: What does a blue circle showing '30' mean?
explanation: A blue circle (not red) with a speed shown indicates minimum speed limit - vehicles must travel at least this fast unless unsafe.

text: What does a blue circle with left and right arrows mean?

options.B: Pass either side to reach same destination

explanation: A blue circle with arrows pointing left and right means vehicles may pass either side of the obstruction.

text: What does a blue circle with a tram symbol mean?
explanation: A blue circle with a tram symbol means the route is for trams only - other vehicles must not enter.

text: What does a blue rectangular sign with a bus symbol and arrow pointing against traffic mean?
explanation: A blue sign showing a bus and arrow indicates a contraflow bus lane - buses travel opposite to other traffic.

text: What do triangular signs with red borders indicate?
explanation: Red triangle signs warn of hazards ahead - you should slow down and be prepared.

text: What does a red triangle with a T-junction symbol mean?
explanation: A red triangle showing a T-junction warns that you're approaching a T-junction where you must give way.

text: What does a red triangle with a cross (+) symbol mean?
explanation: A red triangle with a cross symbol warns of a crossroads ahead where traffic may cross your path.

text: What does a red triangle with three circular arrows mean?
explanation: A red triangle with circular arrows warns of a roundabout ahead.

text: What does a red triangle with a snowflake symbol mean?
explanation: A snowflake in a red triangle warns of risk of ice on the road ahead.

text: What does a red triangle with a windsock/flag symbol mean?
explanation: A windsock symbol warns of strong cross winds or side winds that could affect vehicle control.

text: What does a red triangle with a bicycle symbol mean?
explanation: A bicycle in a red triangle warns that cyclists may be entering or crossing the road ahead.

text: What does a red triangle showing two adults and a child mean?
explanation: Figures shown in a triangle warn of pedestrians likely to be walking in or crossing the road.

text: What does a red triangle with a double bend symbol (S-shape) mean?
explanation: A double-bend (S) symbol warns of a series of bends ahead - first bend is in direction shown.

text: What does a red triangle with a hump/bump profile mean?
explanation: A hump symbol warns of road humps (speed bumps) ahead for traffic calming.

text: What does a red triangle showing two lanes becoming one mean?
explanation: Two lanes reducing to one in a triangle warns that dual carriageway is ending - single carriageway with two-way traffic ahead.

text: What does a red triangle showing a road narrowing from both sides mean?
explanation: Converging lines from both sides warn that the road narrows ahead from both sides.

text: What does a red triangle with an exclamation mark (!) mean?
explanation: An exclamation mark warns of an unexpected danger ahead - the specific hazard will be indicated on a plate below.

text: What does a red triangle with 'Hidden dip' written on a plate below mean?
explanation: This warns of a hidden dip in the road that you cannot see until close - often with 'Hidden dip' text below an exclamation mark.

text: What does a red triangle with a train/fence symbol mean?

options.B: Level crossing with barrier or gate ahead

explanation: A train symbol with fence/barrier warns of a level crossing with barrier or gate ahead.

text: What does a red triangle with a tram symbol mean?
explanation: A tram symbol in a triangle warns that trams may be crossing the road ahead.

text: What does a red triangle showing 10% mean?
explanation: A percentage (like 10%) in a red triangle warns of a steep hill - the percentage is the gradient (10% = 1 in 10).

text: What does a red triangle with 'Ford' written below mean?
explanation: Ford means a shallow water crossing across the road - the triangle warns you the road ahead crosses through water.

text: What does a blue rectangular sign with a white 'P' mean?
explanation: A blue rectangle with white P indicates a parking place.

text: What does a blue square sign showing 'T' dead-end with red bar across top mean?
explanation: A T-shaped dead end sign indicates no through road - the road ahead doesn't continue.

text: What do brown rectangular signs indicate?
explanation: Brown signs indicate tourist attractions, facilities or points of interest.

text: What does a blue motorway sign showing 'Crawler lane' with truck symbol mean?

options.A: Slow vehicles must use hard shoulder
options.B: Lane for heavy and slow vehicles

explanation: A crawler lane is provided for slow-moving vehicles (lorries, trucks) on steep uphill sections of motorways.

text: What does a blue motorway sign with a white arrow curving up-left mean?
explanation: An upward-curving arrow on motorway signs indicates you should leave at the next exit.

text: What does a black sign showing '50' inside amber lights mean?
explanation: Speed shown in amber lights indicates a temporary maximum speed (often due to traffic, weather, or road works).

text: What does a motorway sign showing two vertical arrows with one blocked by red X mean?

options.A: Lane closed ahead - move to open lane

explanation: A red X over a lane means that lane is closed - you must move to an open lane shown by arrows.

text: What does a motorway sign showing '25' in a box on a blue background mean?
explanation: Numbers in boxes on motorway signs indicate junction numbers for navigational purposes.

text: What does a blue sign with motorway symbol crossed by red diagonal line mean?
explanation: A motorway symbol with red diagonal line indicates end of motorway regulations.

text: What does a yellow motorway sign saying 'STAY IN LANE' with lane markings mean?

options.B: Keep in your lane - contraflow system ahead

explanation: STAY IN LANE warns of contraflow system (traffic in both directions using one carriageway) - you must not change lanes.

text: At traffic lights showing red and amber together, what should you do?

options.A: Go if the way is clear
options.B: Stop - do not pass the stop line
options.C: Prepare to go - about to turn green

explanation: Red and amber together means the lights are about to change to green - prepare to go but don't move until green shows.

text: What does a red traffic light with diagonal red bar mean?
explanation: A traffic light showing a red diagonal bar means the lights are not working - treat as unmarked junction (give way to traffic from right).

text: What do alternating flashing red lights mean?

options.B: Level crossing - stop when lights show

explanation: Alternating flashing red lights are at level crossings - you MUST stop when they show as a train is approaching.

text: What does a green filter arrow at traffic lights mean?

options.B: You may go in the direction shown by arrow even if main light is red

explanation: A green filter arrow allows you to proceed in that direction even if the main light is red.

text: When police officer raises arm straight up, what does this mean?
explanation: Arm raised straight up means STOP - traffic must stop from all directions.

text: What do zigzag white lines on the road mean?
explanation: Zigzag lines (near pedestrian crossings or school crossings) mean no parking, stopping, or overtaking in this area.

text: When may you cross a double solid white line in the middle of the road?

options.B: Only to pass a stationary vehicle blocking the lane
options.D: To turn into a property or side road

explanation: You may cross double solid white lines only to enter/exit premises or a side road, or to pass a stationary obstruction.

text: What does a single broken white line along the middle of the road mean?

options.C: Hazard warning line - may cross if safe

explanation: A single broken white center line marks lanes - you may cross it to overtake if safe to do so.

text: What do white triangles painted on the road mean?

options.B: GIVE WAY - you must yield to traffic ahead

explanation: White triangles pointing towards you mean GIVE WAY - you must give priority to traffic on the road you're joining.

text: What does 'STOP' painted on the road with a solid white line mean?

options.B: You MUST stop at the line

explanation: STOP painted on the road with a solid line means you MUST stop at the line even if road appears clear.

text: What does a broken white line across the road at a roundabout entrance mean?

options.B: Give way to traffic from the right

explanation: A give way line (broken white) at roundabout means you must give priority to traffic already on the roundabout (from your right in UK).

text: What do yellow lines painted on the road edge or kerb indicate?
explanation: Yellow lines indicate waiting and parking restrictions - check nearby signs for details of restrictions.

text: What does a longer broken hazard warning line mean compared to normal center line?

options.B: Hazard ahead - do not cross unless you can see road is clear well ahead

explanation: Longer broken lines (hazard warning lines) warn of a hazard ahead - only cross to overtake if you can see far enough ahead that it's safe.

text: What does a car driver's right arm extended straight out mean?
explanation: Right arm extended horizontally means the driver intends to turn right.

text: What does a car driver's arm rotating in a circular motion mean?

options.C: Turning right or changing lane to the right

explanation: Arm moving in a circular motion indicates the driver intends to turn right or move to a lane on their right.

text: What does a motorcyclist's LEFT arm extended at shoulder level mean?
explanation: Left arm extended horizontally from a motorcyclist means they're turning left.

text: What does a motorcyclist's right arm moving up and down mean?
explanation: Right arm moving up and down indicates the rider is slowing down or stopping.
